title: France River
text:
The France River is a tributary of <a href="Chibougamau%20Lake">Chibougamau Lake</a>, flowing into the <a href="Regional%20County%20Municipality">Regional County Municipality</a> (RCM) of <a href="Eeyou%20Istchee%20James%20Bay%20Regional%20Government">Eeyou Istchee Baie-James</a> and in the city of <a href="Chibougamau">Chibougamau</a>, in <a href="Jam%C3%A9sie">Jamésie</a>, in the administrative region of <a href="Nord-du-Qu%C3%A9bec">Nord-du-Québec</a>, in the <a href="Provinces%20and%20territories%20of%20Canada">province</a> of <a href="Quebec">Quebec</a>, in <a href="Canada">Canada</a>.
The course of the river flows into the townships of Bignell, McCorkill and Roy.
The hydrographic slope of the "France River" is accessible by the junction of a forest road (East-West direction)
serving the north side of <a href="Chibougamau%20Lake">Chibougamau Lake</a>; the latter is connected to <a href="Quebec%20route%20167">route 167</a> which also serves the south side of <a href="Waconichi%20Lake">Waconichi Lake</a> and the <a href="Waconichi%20River">Waconichi River</a>. This last road comes from <a href="Chibougamau">Chibougamau</a>, going north-east to the south-eastern part of <a href="Mistassini%20Lake">Mistassini Lake</a>.
The surface of the "France River" is usually frozen from early November to mid-May, however traffic Ice safety is usually from mid-November to mid-April.
Toponymy.
The toponym "rivière France" was made official on December 5, 1968, at the <a href="Commission%20de%20toponymie%20du%20Qu%C3%A9bec">Commission de toponymie du Québec</a>, i.e. at the founding of this commission.
